intro: Leonohebe petriei, commonly known as the New Zealand rock hebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces clusters of tubular flowers in shades of blue, purple, or white, typically blooming in spring. Leonohebe petriei thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to the cool, moist climate of its native habitat.
